title: Mastering Infrastructure Security: Strategies, Tools, and Practices (SKF200)
overview: Empower yourself with the essential skills to fortify digital architectures against contemporary and emerging threats.
requirements: General IT concepts, including operating systems, networking, and cloud computing.
Basic programming skills, especially in scripting languages such as Python or Bash.
Fundamental networking principles, including TCP/IP, DNS, routing, and subnetting.
Basic understanding of infrastructure components like servers, databases, and network equipment.
audience: This course is designed for developers aiming to deepen their understanding of infrastructure security and management, particularly those interested in network penetration testing and infrastructure security skills.

details.certificate: Certificate of Completion and Digital Badge
